item.title: Notes on Mathematical Proofs
item.description: Wrote by a MSc student dying of end-of-term reviews (a.k.a. me). :) means “we want to show” FSOC means “for the sake of controdiction” [x] PS1 [x] PS2 [ ] PS3 [ ] Logic Truth table PS1.Q1 Let \(p\) and \(q\) be two statements Prove that \(\lnot (p \lor q) \iff \lnot p \land \lnot q\). \(p\) \(\lnot p\) \(q\) \(\lnot q\) \(p \lor q\) \(\lnot (p \lor q)\) T F T F T F T F F T T F F T T F T F F T F T F T Direct proof PS2.

item.title: Notes on Introduction to C Language
item.description:
0419 1.2 プリント #include <stdio.h> int main(void) { printf("Hello!

My name is Rachel!
"); return 0; } 2.a 変数 #include <stdio.h> int main(void) { int tokuten = 50; printf("試験の点数は%d点です。
", tokuten); return 0; } 2.b 変数の型 #include <stdio.h> int main(void) { int seisu = 10; double jissu = 3.14; char moji = 'm'; printf("整数は%dです
", seisu); printf("実数は%fです
", jissu); printf("文字は%cです
", moji); return 0; } 2.c 演算子 #include <stdio.h> int main(void) { int x, y, z; x = 25; y = 35; z = x + y; printf("xとyの和は%dです
", z); return 0; } 2.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
